inclusion.criterion: a minimally invasive follicular thyroid carcinoma ≤4 cm in diameter, or a papillary thyroid carcinoma ≤2 cm in diameter.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: previous neck operations; age <21 or >65 years; prior vocal fold paralysis or a history of voice or laryngeal disease requiring therapy;
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: a malignancy with definite extrathyroid invasion, multiple lateral neck node metastasis, perinodal infiltration at a metastatic lymph node, or distant metastasis;
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: a lesion located in the thyroid dorsal area (especially adjacent to the tracheoesophageal groove) caused by possible injury to the trachea, esophagus, or recurrent laryngeal nerve (RLN).
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has metastatic papillary thyroid cancer with worsening dysphagia and poor oral intake. Previous neck operations and age >65 years are potential exclusions, but patient's condition suggests they may be eligible.
